listitem.para: Outputs the remainder of dividing dividend divided by divisor. Both dividend and divisor must be numbers and divisor must not be 0.

Mathematically, a remainder is a number such that dividend = quotient * divisor + remainder Where quotient is an integer and -divisor < remainder < divisor. By this definition, two remainders may be possible for a given divisor and dividend, one positive and one negative. To make MODULO well-defined, it always outputs the remainder whose sign matches that of divisor. In contrast, REMAINDER uses the sign of dividend.
